results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Vaughan Williams: a London symphony - Scherzo (Nocturne) (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”
The sights, sounds and feelings of London at night aptly illustrate the third movement of Vaughan Williams’ London Symphony. The fountain at Marble Arch, pigeons in Trafalgar Square, moving traffic, flickering neon signs, a Cockney blowing on a mouth-organ, are contrasted with the dignity and tradition of the House of Parliament, and the evening mist and sunset along the Thames Embankment. Includes a Study Guide.

results.title: Beef background
results.brief_description: Describes the production of fine cattle and quality beef in Australia for domestic and overseas markets. Includes the angus, devon, hereford and santa catrudez breeds. Narrated by Barry Brady.

results.title: Beef and dairy insemination program
results.brief_description: Describes the artificial insemination program at Bacchus Marsh. Outlines methods of collection, selection and storage as well as service to cows.

results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.

results.title: The N.P. patient = The Neuro psychiatric patient
results.creator_credit: Bureau of Aeronautics and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
A training film designed to help naval hospital staff deal with and help sailors with various psychiatric and behavioral problems, ie the neuro-psychiatric patients.

results.title: Surgical dressings
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates the application of surgical dressings in a naval hospital during World War II. Shows the correct procedures for setting-up the trolley containing instruments, dressings and disposal items. Shows how to minimise infection by ensuring procedures are as sterile as possible.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
